content:
GenericXmlSecurityToken Class

Definition

Represents a security token that is based upon XML.

In this Article

public class GenericXmlSecurityToken : System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken
Inheritance
Object
System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken
GenericXmlSecurityToken

Inherited Members

ResolveKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityKeyIdentifierClause)
Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Remarks

Use the GenericXmlSecurityToken class when you receive a token over the wire that is not defined in a specification or there is no way for you to determine the type of the security token. For example, in a federation scenario when you send a Request Security Token (RST) to a Security Token Service (STS) you do not always know the type of the security token returned by the STS. In such cases, you can use a GenericXmlSecurityToken to store the security token as XML along with its internal and external references.

Use the GenericXmlSecurityToken class to define claims using XML when one of the built-in security tokens does not suffice. Other security tokens can define their claims using XML, however the GenericXmlSecurityToken security token generically allows a security token to have an application-defined set of XML.

Constructors

GenericXmlSecurityToken(XmlElement,SecurityToken,DateTime,DateTime,SecurityKeyIdentifierClause,SecurityKeyIdentifierClause,ReadOnlyCollection<IAuthorizationPolicy>)

Initializes a new instance of the GenericXmlSecurityToken class.

public GenericXmlSecurityToken (System.Xml.XmlElement tokenXml, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken proofToken, DateTime effectiveTime, DateTime expirationTime, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause internalTokenReference, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause externalTokenReference, System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<System.IdentityModel.Policy.IAuthorizationPolicy> authorizationPolicies);
tokenXml
XmlElement

An XmlElement that represents the XML that is associated with the security token. Sets the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.TokenXml* property.

proofToken
System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken

A SecurityToken that represents the proof token for the security token. Sets the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ProofToken* property.

effectiveTime
DateTime

A DateTime that represents the first instant in time at which this security token is valid. Sets the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom* property.

expirationTime
DateTime

A DateTime that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid. Sets the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom* property.

internalTokenReference
SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

A SecurityKeyIdentifierClause that represents a reference to this security token when it is included in a SOAP message in which it is referenced. Sets the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.InternalTokenReference* property.

externalTokenReference
SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

A SecurityKeyIdentifierClause that represents a reference to this security token when it is not included in a SOAP message in which it is referenced. Sets the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom* property.

authorizationPolicies
ReadOnlyCollection<IAuthorizationPolicy>

A stem.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1 of type IAuthorizationPolicy that contains the set authorization policies for this security token.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

tokenXml is null.

-or-

proofToken is null.

Remarks

When the internalTokenReference parameter is null, a LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause key identifier clause is created for this security token and set to the InternalTokenReference property.

When the GenericXmlSecurityToken is obtained in a federation scenario, the proof token contains the key that is encrypted for the client.

Properties

AuthorizationPolicies

Gets the collection of authorization policies for this security token.

public System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<System.IdentityModel.Policy.IAuthorizationPolicy> AuthorizationPolicies { get; }
Value
ReadOnlyCollection<IAuthorizationPolicy>

A stem.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1 of type IAuthorizationPolicy that contains the set authorization policies for this security token.

ExternalTokenReference

Gets a security key identifier clause that references this security token when this security token is not included in the SOAP message in which it is referenced.

public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause ExternalTokenReference { get; }
Value
SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

A SecurityKeyIdentifierClause that represents a reference to this security token when it is not included in a SOAP message in which it is referenced.

Id

Gets a unique identifier of the security token.

public override string Id { get; }
Value
String

The unique identifier of the security token.

Remarks

When the GenericXmlSecurityToken security token is serialized into XML, the value of the Id attribute is set to the value of the Id property.

InternalTokenReference

Gets a security key identifier clause that references this security token when this security token is included in the SOAP message in which it is referenced.

public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause InternalTokenReference { get; }
Value
SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

A SecurityKeyIdentifierClause that represents a reference to this security token when it is included in a SOAP message in which it is referenced.

ProofToken

Gets the proof token for the security token.

public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken ProofToken { get; }
Value
System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken

A SecurityToken that represents the proof token for the security token.

Remarks

The proof token is the security token that the requester of the GenericXmlSecurityToken security token used for authentication in obtaining the GenericXmlSecurityToken security token.

SecurityKeys

Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the proof token.

public override System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey> SecurityKeys { get; }
Value
ReadOnlyCollection<SecurityKey>

A stem.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1 of type SecurityKey that contains the set of keys associated with the proof token.

Remarks

The proof token can be obtained by getting the ProofToken property.

TokenXml

Gets the XML that is associated with the security token.

public System.Xml.XmlElement TokenXml { get; }
Value
XmlElement

An XmlElement that represents the XML that is associated with the security token.

Remarks

The GenericXmlSecurityToken security token is extensible, so exactly what is contained within the XML is application-dependent.

ValidFrom

Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.

public override DateTime ValidFrom { get; }
Value
DateTime

A DateTime that represents the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.

Remarks

Use the ValidFrom and ValidTo properties to determine the time period in which a GenericXmlSecurityToken token is valid. The ValidFrom and ValidTo properties represent the first and last instants in time in which the security token is valid, respectively.

The ValidFrom property is specified using the effectiveTime parameter of the constructor. The value returned from this property is always in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

ValidTo

Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

public override DateTime ValidTo { get; }
Value
DateTime

A DateTime that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

Remarks

Use the ValidFrom and ValidTo properties to determine the time period in which a GenericXmlSecurityToken token is valid. The ValidFrom and ValidTo properties represent the first and last instants in time in which the security token is valid, respectively.

The ValidTo property is specified using the expirationTime parameter of the constructor. The value returned from this property is always in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

Methods

CanCreateKeyIdentifierClause<T>()

Gets a value that indicates whether this security token is capable of creating the specified key identifier clause.

public override bool CanCreateKeyIdentifierClause<T> () where T : System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause;
Returns
Boolean

true when T is not null and the same type as either the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.InternalTokenReference* or stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ExternalTokenReference* property values; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Use the CanCreateKeyIdentifierClause(T) method to determine if a GenericXmlSecurityToken security token can create a specific key identifier. To create the key identifier call the CreateKeyIdentifierClause<T>() method.

CreateKeyIdentifierClause<T>()

Creates the specified key identifier clause.

public override T CreateKeyIdentifierClause<T> () where T : System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause;
Returns
T

A SamlAssertionKeyIdentifierClause that is a key identifier clause for a GenericXmlSecurityToken security token.

Exceptions
SecurityTokenException

T is not null and not the same type as one of the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.InternalTokenReference* or stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ExternalTokenReference* property values.

Remarks

The value of the InternalTokenReference property or the ExternalTokenReference property is returned by the CreateKeyIdentifierClause(T) method depending on the type that is passed into the T parameter.

Use the CanCreateKeyIdentifierClause<T>() method to determine if a GenericXmlSecurityToken security token can create a specific key identifier. To create the key identifier call the CreateKeyIdentifierClause(T) method.

MatchesKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityKeyIdentifierClause)

Returns a value that indicates whether the key identifier for this instance is equal to the specified key identifier.

public override bool MatchesKeyIdentifierClause (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause keyIdentifierClause);
keyIdentifierClause
SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

An SecurityKeyIdentifierClause to compare to this instance.

Returns
Boolean

true when keyIdentifierClause is not null and matches either the stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.InternalTokenReference* or stem.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ExternalTokenReference* property values; otherwise, false.

Remarks

The keyIdentifierClause parameter is matched against the InternalTokenReference and ExternalTokenReference property values using the Matches method on the key identifier clause that is returned by the property values.

ToString()

Returns the current object.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

The current object.

Remarks

The ToString method returns the ValidFrom, ValidTo, InternalTokenReference, and ExternalTokenReference properties.
